alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 7:25PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Monroe County through 800 PM EDT... At 724 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Mount Pocono to Meckesville. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mount Pocono, East Stroudsburg, Stormville, Reeders, Henryville, Brodheadsville, Saylorsburg, Gilbert, Analomink, McMichael, Tannersville, Alpine Mountain, Scotrun, Long Pond, Paradise Valley, Sun Valley, Jonas, Pocono Pines, Stroudsburg and Arlington Heights. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 294 and 313. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 6. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
